svcsubproc.title: Assist Handrails
svcsubproc.para: The assist handrails are located in the step well area and are mounted on the front seat crash barrier assembly. Handrails are also available as options and are mounted in the step well on the step well heater assembly (if equipped), or on the front plate assembly mounted to the right hand dash panel cover and attached to the bus cross beam assembly.
To remove the standard entry assist rail:

step1.para: Locate the hex head mounting screw at the crash barrier panel hand rail attachment.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. ASSIST HANDRAIL CRASH BARRIER MOUNTING SCREW
2. STEP WELL ASSIST HANDRAIL MOUNTING BRACKETS

step1.para: Loosen and remove the hex head mounting screw.
Locate the mounting screws on the lower step well handrail mounting brackets, two on each bracket.
Loosen and remove the mounting screws, remove the assist handrail assembly.
To remove the stainless steel handrail from the lower mounting brackets, locate the set screw on the handrail assist mounting bracket.
Loosen the set screw and remove the handrail.
If the bus is equipped with the optional assist handrail, follow the same basic procedure as outlined in steps 3 through 7.

The top mounting bracket for the forward mounted handrail will be at attached with a mounting screw attachment to the forward dash vertical support bracket or the step well optional heater side cover plate.
Loosen and remove the mounting screw and remove the forward assist handrail (if applicable).
